title: Chinese hackers exploit Notepad++ updater to target select users for months: Report
snippet: Notepad++ says its update system was reportedly hijacked for months in a targeted cyber campaign linked to suspected Chinese state backed hackers, who redirected select users to malicious servers. The breach has been contained, with stronger security checks and update protections now in place.

title: Samsung Galaxy S26 may get Google’s AI scam call detection feature: Here's how
snippet: Samsung’s Galaxy S26 series may introduce Google’s AI-powered scam call detection via Android CallCore, marking the first time the Pixel-exclusive safety feature could arrive on non-Pixel phones, offering real-time alerts and on-device privacy-focused protection.

title: Apple iPhone Air now under  ₹95,000 at Vijay Sales? How to grab the deal
snippet: Vijay Sales rolls out Valentine’s Day discounts on the iPhone Air (256GB), cutting the price to  ₹94,990 from  ₹1,19,900, with an extra  ₹4,000 off on ICICI Bank EMI deals, taking total savings up to  ₹28,910.

title: Grok Imagine 1.0 debuts with better video, audio and smarter prompts: Here's what all is upgraded
snippet: xAI has launched Grok Imagine 1.0, enabling 10-second AI videos at 720p with enhanced audio, expressive voices and smarter prompt understanding. The platform has already generated 1.245 billion videos in 30 days, marking a major step forward in AI video creation.

title: Oppo K14x to launch in India on 10 February with 6,500mAh battery and 120Hz display: All you need to know
snippet: Oppo K14x is set to launch in India on 10 February with a 6.75-inch 120Hz display, MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chip, 50MP camera and a large 6,500mAh battery with 45W fast charging, positioning it as an affordable 5G upgrade over the K13x.

title: Who is Peter Steinberger? Austrian engineer behind Reddit like viral AI platform Moltbook
snippet: Peter Steinberger, creator of the AI-focused app Moltbook, has a history of success with PSPDFKit. He designed Moltbook to facilitate AI interactions without compromising user data ownership, evolving from an initial weekend project to a sophisticated platform.

title: Palantir CEO defends surveillance tech as US government contracts boost sales
